LIGHTS. NEON LIGHTS. A throbbing skyline o neon. LAS VEGAS, NEVADA. As seen from a descending aerial shot. We PLUNGE down into her shimmering embrace... DISSO

Cruising the Strip, taking in modern day Las Vegas. Sin C gone theme park. Gigantic behemoths of pulsating neon: TH MGM GRAND... EXCALIBUR... LUXOR... TREASURE ISLAND... pas revamped faithfuls like CAESARS and THE DESERT INN... ...then heading DOWNTOWN to Fremont Street, where "old sc Vegas makes its last stand. BINION'S HORSESHOE, THE FOUR  QUEENS, THE LAS VEGAS CLUB arid...

One thing's for sure. This place ain't no bastard child o Epcott Center. At least, not yet. Sure there's some flash going on, but it's more class than overkill. This is where the pro's come to savor a time forgotten. A joint where every dealer knows your name. Where part of t allure is the smell of moldy paneling and the tactile whi of worn felt. Where "funny business" doesn't just get you blacklisted... It gets you dead. Lets us enter.

TRACKING through the casino floor; highlighting SLOT MACH PAY-OFFS and pockets of rowdy players winning at BLACKJAC CRAPS and ROULETTE. It's just one of those nights. The ta are on fire. A FLOOR MANAGER nods as a hefty bet is paid out to a shoo at a craps table: He checks out his watch, anxious for th arrival of...
From behind a FIGURE in a suit. All we see is a murky  reflection in gold elevator doors. The floor numbers  descending rapidly...
all anticipating the arrival of...

The elevator doors open... and we PAN DOWN to the figure' feet. He steps out onto the casino floor... and right awa we notice he has a pronounced limp. Following behind the figure. We haven't seen his features yet... (and won't for a while.)

-- the figure (seen in soft focus) passes a ROULETTE TABL the wheel already in mid-spin. His hand casually brushes side of the table... and we PAN ACROSS to the wheel -- ju in time to see the ball landing on 00. The players HOWL  defeat. The croupier rakes in all the losing checks with slight nod of respect to the passing wraith... -- TRACKING PAST SOME BLACKJACK TABLES... RACKING from th passing figure (still in soft focus) to a DEALER calling  out:
Insurance?

At the next table, ANOTHER DEALER pulls a six card 21. Of the players' stunned reactions. No way! One of the player instinctively glances behind him... but the figure has mo on. The dealer stifles a grin, her eyes following the fig as he heads toward... -- A HOT CRAPS TABLE. The CROWD APPLAUDS as the shooter l a hard eight. The dice are fished back to the player. He  shakes them up with double ought bravado. We RACK from hi hand LARGE in the f.g. to our murky figure passing in the background. The player throws... (we keep tracking with t figure) as the stickman calls it: SEVEN OUT! to a thunder chorus of disappointment. -- Our figure passes by in the foreground, while in the  background, we see a growing line of shame at one of the MACHINES. -- Following behind our figure as he turns into a corrido of SLOT MACHINES. CUT TO REVERSE ANGLE from the far end o the corridor. As the murky figure approaches, a player in the f.g. hits a jackpot. Another player in mid-ground is also in the midst of a pa Suddenly -- with the approach of the figure -- both payou trickle to a stop.

(kicks the slot machine) Don't you hold back, baby. Spit it  out, darlin'. C'mon... Hey! Hey,  this ain't right. S'posed to be eight  hundred dollars. Where's the goddamn  manager? Who's in charge of these  rip-off slots? Yo, ma'am... change  lady...
FOLLOWING BEHIND the figure as he turns out of the slot  corridor and heads over to the bar. He pours himself a cu of coffee.
Hey Doris, you got any cream?

DORIS THE BARTENDER wanders over with a small container. starts to pour... Empty. We quickly STEADICAM AROUND to r BERNIE LOOTZ's features for the first time. His sad sack  eyes register scant surprise at the empty cream container
Forget it.

He's just about to leave, when an attractive COCKTAIL WAI cruises up. NATALIE BELISARIO -- late 20's-mid-30's.  Everything about her sparkles, except her eyes. They're post-mortem. She appears frazzled. Sifts through  some coin tips.
(sotto) Shit. (to Doris) Dewars and a Diet Coke. Please.
A sheepish look comes over Bernie. He tries to catch her  eye. She doesn't even glance at him.
Hi, Natalie.
She looks at him. Only the faintest hint of recognition.
Hi. Uh...
Bernie.
Yeah, Bernie. (to Doris) Hey, you seen Shelly around? He  promised to position me at the tables  tonight. I've been on skid row all  week.
(chilly) You didn't settle me from last night.
No? You sure? Fuck... And I was way  under. It's been, like, an A.A.  convention the whole week. I'll make  up for it tonight. Promise.
Doris mutters something under her breath -- heard that on before -- and dumps Natalie's drinks on her tray.
If I see Shelly, I'll let him know.  That you're looking for him.
Natalie grabs up her tray. Doesn't even look at Bernie.
Thanks.
She takes off.
Bitch. That's the third time this  month... (to Bernie) Let me get you that cream.
(staring after Natalie) Nah, it's okay.
Don't get sweet on that, Bernie. Not  unless you're looking to get short- changed.
She raises the empty cream container for effect, turns it over. A few drops dribble out.
Bernie limps away from the bar. We hear another spike of  sound from the gaming area. As he approaches, a FLOORMAN  stops him.
Hey, Bernie, Shelly needs you on  eleven.
(nods) Uh... Let's do the Chivas Regal.  Have that... Natalie bring it over.  The one working nickel slots next to  the Paradise. I spoke to Shelly  earlier, he wants her at the tables.

The floorman nods, walks off. Bernie makes for the rowdy  gaming tables. Takes his time about it. His approach brin an ill-wind to the area. The players appear to sense it. It's in their reactions. A slight hesitation of the dice. Fingers tensing over a pile of chips. A hand tugging at a tie. The Cooler has arrived. As he reaches table eleven, Natalie intercepts him with a short glass of Chivas Regal.
This is you, right?
(takes it from her) Thanks.
Joe said I should stick around. You  say something to Shelly?
Bernie just smiles at her.
Wow. That was fast. Hey, thanks.
She offers up a smile. It jump-starts those dormant eyes. Her whole face comes alive. Notches her up from an eight a ten. Bernie immediately glances away. He's afraid what might read in his gaze.
Don't mention it.
Bernie gestures her over to table eleven. Immediately mak the HIGH ROLLER in question. A good old boy named BULLDOG He's the one boasting loudly as he shakes the dice with o hand.
I'll make you a fortune on five and  nine. C'mon forty-five-sixty-three  fifty-four!
Bernie grabs the drink from Natalie's tray, intentionally bumps Bulldog...
Hey, buddy, is this your drink?
Back off, pal. I'm on a roll here.
Another man gladly accepts the drink. Meanwhile, Bulldog  sends the dice high up into the air. They drop perfectly the table. The stickman calls it.
Seven out!
Mother-fucker!
Thank you for those bets, folks.

The croupiers hungrily devour the chips from the table. Bernie moves on quietly before anyone notices. But he's been noticed all right. By Natalie. Not quite su what she's just witnessed. Who is this guy? We hear a VOICE over the intercom.
Conway, party of twelve, please check  your reservation at the Paradise  Lounge.
Bernie reacts immediately to the code words over the spea
(to himself) Yeah, yeah, I'm comin'...
A -- a player makes a hard six at a craps table. The play howl... B -- from the same angle we PAN UP from losing dice to th same guy. Bernie looming large in the background.

A -- Bernie taking a seat at another blackjack table. Nex to him, a full table of players on a good run of cards. B -- The same table with less players as the dealer appea to be gaining an edge over the players. The only thing fi up are ashtrays. C -- Same again, with one player. This time with Natalie  watching in the background. Intrigued. QUICK JUMP CUTS sh the player's mountain of chips going down until there is  only one. D -- The dealer taps the felt for the man to bet his last chip. After a moment of indecision he flips the chip into the air...

...the chip becoming an Alka-Seltzer dropping into a glas The glass is in SHELLY KAPLOW's hand. Director of Casino  Operations for the Shangri-la. Late 40's-early 50's. Distinguished, slick, oozing charm. But lose the Cartier, Armani and Paco Raban and you're looking at pure street. He's watching Bernie through the two-way glass. Shakes hi head in admiration. Suddenly the office door swings open. THREE MEN stride in Shelly projects immediate deference to NICKY "FINGERS"  BONNATTO. Mid-50's. Former Geovassi family underboss from "back east." The guy's a relic from the days before MBAs  became the weapon of choice in the "family" business. He  wears his corporate makeover like a bad coat of paint wit traces of Mulberry Street primer showing through. Nicky's accompanied by a pair of CORPORATE TYPES in Hugo  Boss threads. Shelly glances their way with a look that  suggests he's working himself into a full-on sphincter wi up. Bad news x2. Shelly's muscle, LOU stands off to one s with an apologetic expression.
Nicky, how the hell are you? I didn't  know you were coming in...
Nicky reaches out to shake Shelly's hand. Gets nothing ba then remembers.
(shakes his head) Whassimater? You think I don't wash  up after goin' to the John? Forget  about it.
Nicky grabs Shelly, embraces him.
(uncomfortably) You shoulda called ahead. I woulda  sent a car...
Ehh. We thought we'd surprise you.
Well, anytime, Nicky. Anytime.
Shelly sizes up the corporate types.
Shelly, I want you to meet one of  our smartest VPs, Larry Sokolov. And  his numbers guy, Marty Goldfarb.
Shelly sees where this is going. Larry extends his hand..
How do you do, Shelly?
...then catches himself. Quickly pulls it back. Shelly st him down for a tense beat.
What can I get you boys to drink?
Off their uncomfortable expressions...
Shelly seated across from Nicky, Larry and Marty.
So... what brings you to town, Nicky?
Nicky looks cautiously across the table.
Look, Shelly, this is your joint,  you run it the way you see fit. But  we got a smart kid here and he's got  some good ideas on how to revitalize  the Shangri-la.
Revitalize? What are you talking  about? We did thirty-five million  last year.
Nicky shoots a look over at Larry and Marty. Larry takes  this as his cue.
First off, Shelly, I want you to  know, I have nothing but respect for  you. You've done a fantastic job  with the Shangri-la for the last  sixteen years. No one would dispute  that.
Yeah, no one doubts that, Shelly.
Shelly nods carefully. But...
But, the business has changed out  here. You just have to take a look  at the Strip to see what I'm talking  about.

You mean, that amusement park mook  fest out there? You know what that  is? That's a fucking violation of  something that used to be beautiful.  That used to have class. Like a  gorgeous high priced hooker with an  exclusive clientele. And then that  Steve Wynn cocksucker knocks her up  and puts her in a family way.
Nicky and Larry exchange looks. Marty drops his gaze into his lap.
Now she's nothing but a cheap, fat  whore hiding behind too much makeup.  I look at her and see all those ugly  stretch marks and I want to cry.  'Cause I remember her as she was.
Yes, well... there's no denying the  bottom line. Those eyesores are raking  it in. And we can't compete against  that.

What? You think I'm trying to compete  with that? You think this joint's  about bringing in the stroller crowd?  Fresh off some fucking E-ticket ride,  looking to break the house on red  and black. Fremont's never been about  that bullshit. This is where old  time and real money comes to play.
The numbers, they don't back you up,  Shelly. Nostalgia's grand. We all  love nostalgia -- but it belongs in  a museum. I think it's time to decide  whether you're running a museum or a  casino.
Shelly is close to losing it. He catches himself, takes a breath.
Hey, forget about it. We'll talk  later. Over dinner.
(rubs his hands  together) So, how's the action?
Larry shoots him a disapproving look. Off Shelly's distur expression. He's already calculating serious damage contr
Bernie makes his way across the casino floor, when he's  intercepted by Shelly.
Bernie. Mr. Cool. Got a moment?
I was just heading over to --
It can wait.
Shelly escorts Bernie over to a nearby bar area. The BART zips over with some drinks.
How's the knee?
Bernie shrugs. Natalie steps up to the bar a few feet awa Puts in a drink order. She catches Bernie's eye. Nods. Bernie smiles.

I was speaking to this orthopedic  surgeon over at Vegas Memorial. He  tells me they can replace a man's  entire kneecap with titanium. It's  the kinda thing that costs a shitload,  but since the man's into us for five  hundred large, I'm sure we could --
(stealing glances at  Natalie) I told you, I'm not gonna be around  after Sunday.

(sighs) Where you gonna go, Bernie? Where  the fuck are you gonna go that's  better'n here? I got you covered in  this town. People, they know you  work for me, that's currency in your  pocket. That's fuckin' respect when  you walk the floor. Where you gonna  get that anyplace else?
(sighs) Seven days, Shelly. Seven days and  I'm out from under.

A beautiful WOMAN in a low cut dress, sashays her way pas them, heading for a high rollers craps table. Shelly reac out, napkin in hand, grabs her arm. Hands her his card. S snatches it, looks it over. Immediately loses all attitud Oh shit.

That's right. I like to know who's  shopping it in my neighborhood. You  wanna keep working the Shangri-la,  you come see me tomorrow morning in  my office. We'll go over the rules  together. And before you come, you  bring me a clean bill of health. OK?
The hooker just nods.
All right, get outta here.
She takes off. At the same time Natalie leaves with her d order. They walk in the same direction. Shelly mistakes  Bernie's wandering look for interest in the hooker.
You want that, Bernie? She's yours.  Anytime. I'll keep a tab running for  you. (Bernie shakes his  head) What's a matter? Not your type?
Bernie just stares after Natalie, Shelly finally picking on it.
Things are getting hot on fourteen.  I gotta go.
He limps off. Shelly stares after him. A predator seizing his prey. Calculating.

Bernie's 1958 Buick Electra pulls into the parking lot of flea-bag motel. Next door to the motel, we see a convenie store with the name, THE EZ MARK in pink glowing neon. It actually supposed to read: The EZ MARKET, but the last tw letters of "Market" have burned out.

One of those center pool style motels. A hard luck oasis, ever there was one. As Bernie limps toward his room, his neighbor, a low rent HOOKER, approaches from the opposite end of the courtyard with a huge-ass JOHN in tow. They converge at their doors at the same time. There's a  weariness about the hooker that's endemic to this town. S winks at Bernie. He nods at her. Then casts a furtive gla over at the John. The man flips him off. The hooker mouth "Sorry." Bernie hastily enters his apartment.

Bernie flips on the light. A dim overhead bulb hardly mak a dent in the gloomy surroundings. Typical drab motel  furnishings. We notice a couple of dead plants on the radiator next to the window. A single place setting on the counter. Someth odd: an empty cat food bowl on the kitchenette floor. No  sign of a cat. Go figure. Bernie heads over to the dresser. A half-filled bottle of gin rests next to a lone glass with a crack down the side He pours himself a shot. Turns on the TV. A religious cha Shitty reception.

an Appalachian Pentecostal service. The members of the  congregation taking up snakes and writhing around in reli hysteria, while a number at the bottom of the screen soli viewer donations. Bernie doesn't even try to change the channel. He takes a seat on his bed, props himself up against a pair of pillo stretches out. From next door, the sounds of wild humping.
...Oh yeah, baby, give it to me. Oh  yeah, that's the spot... Do it to me  harder, you big stud... Oooooh...

Bernie closes his eyes, tries to ignore the X-rated sound coming at him through the carpaccio thin walls. The hooker's moans are starting to get to him. He raises fist to the wall, then stops himself. He's just not the  confrontational type. Instead, he heads over to the TV, cranks the volume up. T hysterical moaning from the snake ritual now blends in wi the grunting and groaning from next door, making for a bi remix that could only exist in the world of Bernie Lootz. Bernie emits a deep sigh, closes his eyes.
Big action at the craps tables tonight. The players cheer MR. PINKERTON makes another pass. He exudes USED CAR SALE Natalie arrives with his drink.
Seven and Seven?
Pinkerton reaches for the drink without taking his eyes o the table. He throws a hard six. The crowd cheers again. He turns around, stuffs a hundred dollar chip down her sh and slyly cops a feel.
Thanks, dollface.
Natalie shudders in disgust. She spins around to leave... runs smack into Bernie, spilling her tray of drinks on hi
Oh shit... Sorry... I'm such a klutz.
Bernie wipes himself off, helps her pick up the pieces.
It's all right. Happens.
Natalie tries to wipe him down a bit more.
Sorry, this guy... fuckin' hands,  you know...
S'okay. You might want to stick  around.
Bernie wiggles his way next to Pinkerton. He gives the  stickman a certain look.
Excuse me, Mr. Pinkerton. You have  no hard eight.
(throwing in a chip) Gimmie a hundred dollar hard eight.
Bernie just watches as Pinkerton throws the dice.
Eight the hard way!
The players go nuts. The stickman taps the felt in front the shooter.
Nine hundred dollars to Mr. Pinkerton.
Parlay! Parlay!
The Boxman seated at the center looks up at him.
C'mon. You can take that action.
The Boxman feigns concern, then nods in approval.
That's what I'm talking about. None  of this low limit bullshit.
Just as the stickman feeds Pinkerton the dice, Bernie fli a dollar chip over toward the center of the table. Natali peers between them to catch a glimpse.
Dollar hard eight.
The chip lands on Pinkerton's parlayed bet. He releases t dice from his stubby little fingers.
Eight easy! Easy eight! Hard eight  comes down.
The players cry out in defeat. Pinkerton grumbles to hims He fingers his rail of chips.
Five hundred dollar hard eight. And  press my nine up two units.
He throws in the chips. The croupier places his bets. The dice are fed back to him. He throws.
Easy way eight! Eight easy!
Pinkerton is fit to be tied. After a passing moment of cl he empties his entire rail.
Hard eight.
The entire table stops down for a second.
Way to go, Pinkie! Bet the farm.
Pinkerton sets his dice carefully and lets them fly.
Seven out!
Pinkerton slams his fist down on the table. He turns to l the table to find Natalie smiling at him.
What the fuck you smiling at, bitch?
Pinkerton starts to lose it. Security moves in, right on  time. Natalie shoots Bernie a satisfied look. He averts h eyes shyly and limps away. She stares after him for a mom

BUDDY STAFFORD, the Paradise Lounge's star attraction, is performing on stage. He's a poor man's Tony Bennett. Mid late 60's. A staple at the Paradise for the last 20 years The singer sluggishly descends the stage to the lounge fl almost tripping over his microphone cable. Buddy works the room, leaning in real close to the ladies delivering the requisite eye contact. When their companio react with mock outrage, Buddy raises his fists playfully a boxer's defensive stance. It's classic Buddy Stafford  schtick. From somewhere across the lounge, an ATTRACTIVE WOMAN jum up and throws her panties at Buddy. Buddy catches them an waves them in the air... just as another pair whizzes by. We PAN ACROSS to Shelly seated at his corner booth, in th company of Nicky Fingers, Larry and Marty. TIGHT ON SHELLY as he focuses on Buddy. A smile threatens his patented stoicism. He's flashing back on the old days While Nicky and Marty are clearly enjoying Buddy's  performance, Larry fixates on the singer with joyless eye We take on LARRY'S POV of Buddy -- SLOW MOTION CLOSE-UPS of BUDDY SINGING. The MUSIC SLOWED  DOWN with the action, emphasizing Buddy's lack of energy. Sweat dripping off Buddy's forehead, splattering into tin jewels against his microphone. Buddy's tired eyes. Shakin hands around the mic. SMASH CUT to real time APPLAUSE as Buddy reaches the end the song. Larry is the only one not clapping. RACK ACROSS Shelly as he picks up on this.
Shelly approaches Buddy's dressing room. He enters withou knocking...
...to find a trembling Buddy hunched over on a sofa, hugg himself. Buddy immediately sits up...
Shelly. I was a goddamn embarrassment  tonight. I shouldn'a let you talk me  into going on. (massages his throat) It's definitely strep.
You were velvet out there, pops.  Silk.
Shelly throws a pair of red silk panties to Buddy. We see room number scribbled on the crotch area.
They were hanging on the door outside.  Forget your tonsils. When the muff  confetti stops coming, that's when  you got yourself a problem.
(dangling the panties  on his finger) You get a receipt?
Excuse me?
Charmayne's in the lobby. They got  these on sale in the window. Victoria  Secret's Valentine's Collection. And  the broad waiting in the room, what  she set you back? Always Grade-A for  Ol' Buddy.

Are you kidding me? Gimme that. (snatches the panties  away from Buddy) You don't fucking deserve this. All  those ladies going home with a sweet  breeze between their legs because  you still do it for them and you're  fingering me for some kinda Buddy  Stafford ego pimp. Hey, fuck you,  old man.
Shelly feigns as if he's leaving.
(affectionately) Get back here, you prick. Hand it  over.

Shelly throws the panties back at Buddy. Buddy just stare at him with pained eyes, waiting for something else. Swea mirror balls his wrinkled forehead. Shelly nods. Removes a foil package from his pocket. Hand it to Buddy. The singer rushes over to his dressing table Unwraps his works. Rubber tubes his forearm. Trembling ha juggle lighter and hypodermic. Shelly takes a seat on the sofa. Buddy, euphoric as the d hits the spot. Tears in his eyes. He picks up on Shelly's somber expression in the mirror.
Whassimatter, kid? You got that  Nostradamus look.
Shelly shakes his head.
You ever watch those nature shows on  TV?
Shelly shakes his head.
I've seen this one a dozen times.  It's about lions. Cycle of life thing.  The leader of the pack...
Pride. It's called a pride.

Yeah, pride. The leader of the  pride... when he gets on in years.  It's just a matter of time before  some young male arrives on the scene  to challenge him. They go at it and  the old cat gets the crap beaten  outta him. It's humiliating. In front  of all the females, this goes down.  And after he's defeated, he's cast  out of the pride, to scavenge and  die alone in the bush.
Yeah, nature's got a real sick sense  of humor.

No shit. It's fucking tragic because  the old lion can't figure it out on  his own. That he's past it. It'd be  so much easier for him to just walk  away and save himself all that pain  and humiliation.
That's like admitting to yourself  that you're already dead. I prefer  nature's way.
(a beat) Yeah. Me, too.
Shelly holds Buddy's gaze in the mirror.
Shelly exits the dressing room, to find Larry waiting on  him. He's accompanied by a good looking YOUNG MAN.
Shelly, got a minute...
Shelly's expression: no. But he heads over anyway.
Shelly, this is Johnny Capella.
How ya doin', Shelly?
Johnny extends his hand. Shelly ignores the gesture.
I know you from somewhere, right?
Johnny's been opening for Danny Ganz  at the Mirage. Sony's talking about  signing him to a three album deal.  They're positioning him as the new  Ricki Martin.
And I should be interested in this,  why?
Johnny's looking to headline. I told  him we might be interested.
(icy) We?
Hey, if this is a bad time...
Even if I were interested, Buddy's  got ink with us through 2003. I just  renegotiated his contract last year.
Sounds like the two of you need to  get on the same page. (to Larry) If I don't hear from you by Thursday,  I'm taking the Stardust's offer.
Johnny nods at Shelly, takes off. Shelly and Larry eyebal each other for a long, cold beat. Shelly's about to say  something, when Nicky and Marty approach. Larry shrugs,  flashes a chilling smile.
Where's Buddy? I wanna buy the old  fart a drink.
Buddy asked me to send you his  regards, Nicky. He's not feeling so  great. I think he's got that stomach  flu that's going around.
Oh yeah? That's too bad. (Shelly isn't fooling  him) Well, another time then.
Hey, Shelly, Nicky says you might be  able to hook us up with some  showgirls. Something with class.
Shelly eyeballs Marty for a tense, extended beat. What do look like, some fuckin' pimp, college boy? Just as Marty' starting to get real uncomfortable, Shelly cracks a smile
Sure, no problem. You got any  preferences?
(jumps in) Yeah. Something with big headlights,  nice rims and low mileage.
You got any Asian babes?
Shelly looks to Larry.
I think I'll just stick with the  tables.
We linger on Shelly's unsettled look. This guy is bad new
Bernie weaves his way through the lot to his car. Arrivin at his Buick, he's startled to find Natalie leaning again it. She holds up the $100 chip the drunk tipped her.
Buy you a drink?
Off of Bernie's surprised expression...

Cheesy Polynesian decor. Mood lighting = an excuse to kee the electric down. Basically, a joint where people come t lose themselves. Natalie and Bernie are seated in a booth near the back. S sips on an umbrella drink; he's nursing his usual gin. Natalie has an astrological chart in front of her. In bet sips, she makes annotations to the chart.

(almost to herself) Your Progressed Venus is Gemini,  12.5 Degrees, and is in Direct motion.  Which tells me that you're a slow  starter when it comes to romance. (off Bernie's taken  aback expression) You know what? This is real  unprofessional of me. I shouldn't  discuss your chart with you until  I'm all done. I can tell by that  look, you think this is all a lot of  B.S.
No... I just know what the outcome's  going to be.
The outcome? There's not, like, one  particular outcome. A lot of things  enter into it. The planets, moon  phases...
The outcome won't change with me.  It'll be all bad.

God, I have never met anyone who was  so down on themselves. I used to be  down on myself, OK? I don't go there  anymore. I've got just three more  correspondence classes with this  stuff, then I'll have my certificate  and everything. And you know how I  got OK?
(deadpan) You had your chart done.
Yes, as a matter of fact that is  perfectly correct.
Do you know what I do at the Shangri- la?
I asked around. You're a "cooler."  You turn winners into losers.
And do you know how I do that?
I know there's stuff that goes on in  casinos all the time --
I do it by being myself. People get  next to me and their luck turns.  It's always been that way.

That sounds to me like a self  fulfilling prophecy. There's a whole  chapter on that in my course. Anyways,  I can see a big factor in your life  is that you're lacking companionship.  There's nobody to deflect off. If  you've got, as you put it, bad karma,  then you need someone with good karma  to neutralize it. Well, that's my  take on it anyway.
Bernie maintains eye contact with Natalie for an extended beat. Then drops his head, gazes at his glass.
I don't know about you, but I'm real  tired.
Natalie nods. Bernie motions to stand. Natalie just remai seated. Keeps talking.

I have this recurring dream where  I'm on some beautiful island in the  Bahamas. I'm sitting on the beach,  taking in this amazing sunset with  one of these in my hand (gestures to her drink) ...and then it starts to rain. And I  wake up and it's my roof leaking on  me. Yeah, I'm also real tired, Bernie.
(not even sure why  he's telling her  this) I only got six more days. Well, almost  five really. Then I'll be leaving  town.
Only five more days? (a beat) Then we shouldn't waste any more  time.
Natalie covers Bernie's hand with hers.
Why don't we go back to your place?
(completely caught  off-guard) I, uh... If this is... I don't know...  I don't know if I can afford...

Who's laughing now, huh? ya fuckin!  prick! C'mon, crack wise again... Ya  fuckin' smooth as a Ken doll, no- dick, suburbanite scum. How's that  for a game?!

Shelly alerted to the fracas, rushes back to the table. H takes immediate control of the situation. Snaps his finge at security. The suburbanite is whisked away with a pocke of comps and a bruised ego. Shelly takes Nicky aside, att to calm him. Nicky keeps railing at Shelly:
That ain't right, Shelly! Guy fucks  up my game like that. Who the fuck  does he think he is?
You're right. He's just a piece of  shit. Forget about him.
I thought this joint had more class.  Used to be, we wouldn't even let  bums like that in...
Nicky catches himself. He looks at Shelly for a beat. There's an unspoken understanding between them. "The good old days." We see Bernie in the b.g., looking more than a bit shocked.
Bernie seated with Natalie.

This town... You know, Natalie, all  I want to do is go some place where  I can tell day from night. Where  they got clocks on the wall. I can't  breathe around here no more. Four  days and I'm gone. I'm not even sure  I can hold out that long.
(a beat) So where does that leave us?

A week ago, I didn't remember what  it was like to have a woman's hands  on me. I'm still pinching myself,  expecting to wake-up from... (just blurts it out) Come with me, Natalie. I want you to  come with me.
God, Bernie, that's...
I'm sorry. I didn't mean to spring  that on you.
Bernie... I want to be with you. I  do. But I don't know if I can leave  with you.
Bernie's look: Why?
I was working on a compatibility  chart for the two of us. And it looks  good, really, it does.
So, what's the problem?
That's with us here. In Vegas.
Bernie's expression: Oh.

Maybe I was being presumptuous, 'cause  I knew you were leaving... and I  tried working it in different ways...  It wasn't good, Bernie. I got scared.  But that's just for now, for the  immediate future. Once the planets  realign, maybe a year from now...
Natalie... I can't... Not another  year. Not another week.
A somber mood falls on the table. Bernie reaches for Nata hand. Instead, he knocks the salt over. It spills out in  front of them.
I think... we probably shouldn't see  each other anymore.
Why, Bernie? We only got a couple  days left together. Why not make the  most of them?
(a long beat) Because if I spend one more night in  your arms, I'm not going anywhere.
And that's so bad?
Bernie just stares at her, shrouded in sadness. Natalie s out her cigarette, rises.
Take care, Bernie.
Bernie casts his eyes to the mound of spilled salt in fro of him. Nods. A few beats later he raises his head...
Natalie, don't...
Gone. A WAITRESS appears.
Get you another?
(nods) I think you better bring me the  bottle. Please.

Once again, we see Bernie's feet limp across the casino f He walks up to the bar, asks for a cup of coffee. Doris brings it over. Short on the cream again. He just sips it black. Gloom and doom features. Life suck His master's VOICE sounds over the intercom:
Chang, party of fifteen, your table  is ready, Chang party of fifteen.
Bernie looks to Doris. Sighs. Only three more days.

He heads for the crap tables, the sound of raucous CHEERI becomes audible. A large crowd starting to gather. Bernie noodles his way to the front of the crowd. As soon he gets a look at the heavy hitter at the table, he tense up. Oh shit. It's MIKEY. With Charlene. Charlene is making one hell of racket. Playing up her extremely maternal state. Just then Natalie sidles up to Bernie with the Chivas Reg Without thinking about it, he grabs the glass off the tra downs it in a single gulp.
(clutching her tummy) Come on, Mikey. This is our future.  Don't blow it.
Mikey throws down a bet for the dealer.
Put this on the line for the boys.
The stickman thanks him as they place the bet. Mikey thro down more money. We can see Mikey has bets all over the t
With shoes!
Dealer's got shoes. Hands high, the  dice are out! The point is nine.
Come on all you's. Put a good thought  in for our baby!
As everyone dotes over Charlene, Mikey quickly swaps the  dice before anyone can see. He throws.
Six the hard way!
Mikey is paid nine thousand by the croupier, as is Charle Bernie stands frozen. He doesn't bother trying to get any closer to the table. He knows it'll do no good.
Oh my god, I just felt him kick! He  knows. He knows you're all pulling  for him. God bless you all.
Natalie looks over at Charlene. Their eyes meet for a sec It's as though Natalie knows it's a scam and Charlene's  acknowledging it. Mikey throws again.
Six the hard way! Look out, we got a  shooter!
Another nine grand. Mikey's rail is nearly full. Charlene hops around awkwardly causing more distraction. Bernie is really sweating it out now. Then Shelly arrives Larry is hot on his tail.
How much?
Eighteen thousand since I stepped  up. I'm sorry, Shelly, I guess I've  been hit and miss lately.
Shelly's expression tells us he isn't so sure. Something  definitely isn't kosher. As Charlene chatters on, Mikey switches the dice back. Shelly makes him.
(sotto) Fucking amateurs...
Mikey throws...
Seven out! Line away.
The players and crowd, though disappointed, applaud Mikey achievement.
(bowing) I thank you. My wife thanks you. My  unborn child thanks you.
Mikey moves his rail of chips to the felt.
Color me up will ya?
Larry notices Shelly slipping on a pair of leather gloves
You've gotta be kidding me. (off Shelly's steely  glare) That's not how I propose we handle  it. We'll turn the matter over to  the authorities. They'll be  blacklisted, their credit ruined...
(gets in Larry's face) And then we'll give 'em both a  lollipop for the ride home. Come  watch and learn, Harvard. A little  lesson on how to protect your  investment -- the old school way.
Shelly walks over to Mikey and Charlene, Larry lingering  behind him.
Hey, that was some run you had back  there.
Uh, thanks. Just lucky I guess.
Mikey steals a tense glance at Charlene. She starts to fi nervously.
Why don't we go do this in my office?  I don't like to hand out all this  amount of cash on the floor.

Security (Tony and Lou) corrals the couple. Leads them aw Bernie watches as they pass by. Mikey looks into Bernie's eyes. They both know he's been made. Natalie doesn't say  anything, just looks at Bernie.

Slot machines everywhere -- some on the way out, some on way in. Crates of casino supplies. Bernie rushes in with Natalie behind him. Heading for an  aural beacon of BLOWS landing on flesh... GRUNTING,  PLEADING... ...arriving to find Tony and Lou kicking the shit out of  Mikey on the floor. Charlene lies clutching her belly a f feet away. Shelly swings a baseball bat, warming up for s blood sport. Larry watches from the sidelines -- at once  appalled and enthralled.
Oh my God... I can feel the  contractions coming on...
Bernie rushes over to Shelly...
Shelly, stop them! Don't do this!
Get lost, Bernie, this got nothing  to do with you.
It's got everything to do with me.  He's my son.
Everyone stops dead. Freeze frame. Shelly gets a weird lo in his eye. A fuse has just been lit...
What did you say?
I said, he's my --
Who? This little prick?
Shelly smashes Mikey across the shoulder with the bat. AARRRGGGGHHH!!! Shelly raises the bat to cream Mikey agai Bernie grabs Shelly's arm. Shelly shoves him back. Raises the bat again...
Pop, help me...
Shelly, don't you fucking do it!
Shelly freezes. He lowers the bat, throws it aside. Grabs Bernie by his collar...
Were you in on this? Jesus, you better  come clean with me.
NO! God, no! I didn't know nothing  about it.
Shelly releases Bernie. There's a strange look in Shelly' eye. We see the wheels turning...
How much you think their lives are  worth, Bernie? Myself, I don't think  they're worth piss. But, hey, it  ain't my kid...
Bernie sees where Shelly's going with this. We can almost hear the cell door slamming in his head.
Let me see: they were up almost a  hundred and fifty grand. That's 150  G's someone's gonna have to account  for. What do you say, Bernie, seventy- five grand a piece?
Bernie glances over at Natalie. She has tears in her eyes He looks to Shelly pleadingly. Please don't do this...
Hey, I know you don't have that kind  of cash. But, since you're a friend  of the house, I'm willing to front  you.
Shelly, they didn't get away with  the money... You didn't lose  anything...
Shelly glances over at Lou, nods. Lou kicks Mikey in the  face. His nose snaps like a twig.
Oh Jesus... Yes! All right. It's on  me. 150 G's.
Charlene clutches her belly, moans...
Oh god, oh god... you gotta get me  to the hospital... contractions...
Shelly, please help her. That's my  grandson...
Hey, why don't we all break out the  champagne? Lootz is about to become  a granddaddy. (walks over to her) How you doin' there, sweetheart?  Must hurt like crap, huh?
(nods) Hurts so bad...
Yeah?
Suddenly Shelly kicks Charlene in the belly! WHAM! She  screeches out.
Oh God...
Jesus NOOOOO!!!

Even Shelly's goons can't believe what they've just witne Larry is aghast. Bernie rushes Shelly, starts raining blo on him. Shelly swats him off. He drops down next to the  squirming girl, rips her sweater and blouse up over her  stomach... ...to reveal a mound of fake padding. He tears the paddin away from her, throws it at Bernie.
Here! It's a fuckin' boy. Anyone got  a cigar?
The muscle start laughing it up. Relief. Larry emits a ne giggle. Natalie's jaw hits the floor. Bernie takes a step back. He's about to go into serious shock. Charlene curls over, sobbing.
(to Bernie) You sure you still want to be good  for it? Because if you want to change  your mind, I don't blame you.
Bernie looks over at Mikey. He stares up at his father,  trembling.
I'll make it up to you, Pop, I  swear...
Bernie holds his son's gaze for a beat. He's almost tempt to... He just shrugs and nods at Shelly.
It's on me.
(shakes his head) That's the worst fucking call you  ever made in your life.

ON NATALIE at that moment. We can tell she agrees with  Shelly... but thinks all the more of Bernie for it. That  might even be love in her eyes. Shelly snatches his baseball bat up off the floor. Walks  over to Mikey, and brings it down full force, pulverizing Mikey's left kneecap. Oh man, the scream...
What are you doing?! I thought we  had --
150 G's buys their lives. This is  just a little slap on the wrist to  remember me by.
Natalie turns her head. She's about to throw up. Larry  watches, unflinchingly. Charlene is making with some seri pleading now.
Oh god... it wasn't my idea.
Shelly steps up to Charlene, tapping the base of the bat the palm of his hand. He smiles reassuringly at her.
You know, motherhood is a beautiful  thing. This... you made a mockery  out of it. Maybe you'll get to  experience it for real one day.
(nods, sobbing) I want... to be a mother... please  don't hurt me...
I'm not going to hurt you.

Shelly turns his back on her. Charlene starts sobbing rel They're not going to hurt her. It's going to be all right Wrong. Shelly throws the bat to Lou. The heavy steps up t the plate (as we RACK FOCUS to Shelly walking away) --  CRUNCH!!! followed by the girl's SHRIEKS. Natalie buries head in Bernie's shoulder.
(to Tony and Lou) Get 'em outta here. You ever see  them in this joint again, kill 'em.
(to Bernie and Natalie) You two, you're still on shift.
Shelly catches Larry's eye: I hope you were taking notes.
Bernie's seated on the edge of his bed, drowning his sorr with a bottle of gin. Moonlight paints him in jail bars o shadow. Natalie lingers in the b.g.

I did this to myself. I planted the  seed. When Angela took off with Mikey,  I didn't... I never made an effort  to get back in his life. I figured,  the kid don't need a loser for a  father. Now it's all come full circle.  I give him the money, I open the  door to all this... I musta had it  coming. Payback.

Natalie's hand lowers the needle onto the Sinatra record. "Nice 'n' Easy" starts up. She walks over to Bernie, takes the bottle away. Helps hi to his feet. He gives himself over to her reassuring embrace. Natalie  raises Bernie's face to her's.
Bernie, it's a big world out there.  If you just took off -- if we took  off.
Bernie shakes his head. It's too late for that now.
Natalie staring up at the ceiling, Bernie nuzzled against her. Her features appear softer than ever. Luminous in th moonlight. Realization moist in her eyes.
You awake, Bernie?
He grunts something inaudible.
I -- think I love you.
Bernie tenses up. Huh?
No, I don't think. I'm pretty certain  of it.
Bernie raises his head, not quite sure he heard her right Natalie sits up, hugs her knees. Bernie finds himself sta at her back.
You blind-sided me, Bernie Lootz. I  never saw this coming. You shouldn't  do that to a girl.
Bernie reaches out, caresses her back. She emits a shiver
There's still things you don't know...  should know... I don't want to ruin  it...
Bernie pulls Natalie back toward him.
It won't make any difference, Natalie.  Whatever you come clean about, I'm  not gonna feel any different about  you. I'd say the words, but with my  luck...
Say 'em anyway. To hell with rotten  luck. That's overs.
(a beat) I love you, Natalie.
Natalie smothers her lips against Bernie's. He enshrouds in his arms. Fade out...
Fade into SOFT FOCUS. Slowing taking form... A CAT'S FACE seen in extreme close-up. WIDER -- to reveal the cat resting on Bernie's chest. She MEOWS as he stirs awake. He's stunned to see her there.
Trixie?
The cat jumps off his chest and slinks over to her empty  food bowl. Meows again. Bernie breaks into a wide smile.
Trix. You came back.

Bernie shields his eyes from the bright sunlight streamin in through the blinds. Huh? This is a first for him. He's never gotten direct sunlight in his room before. What's t deal? Did the world just turn on its axis? He glances over his shoulder... No Natalie. Just her  impression in the sheets. And a note on her pillow. For a moment his heart stops. He conjures up the worst. Grabs u the note, unfolds it. We see a lipstick kiss and the words: HAVE A SPECTACULAR
Bernie lets out a joyful whoop! Leaps out of bed...

CLOSE-UP: Trixie eating some tuna out of her bowl. We hea the record player needle drop on "Luck Be A Lady." Cut to Bernie's feet gliding around the room... PAN UP to Bernie dancing with himself. He's positively aglow. He snatches a salt shaker and sings along with Sinatra. It's true --  love makes the world go around. It obviously also gives l to dead plants, as evidenced by the small bulb that has s up overnight above his radiator. But we won't dwell on th

Bernie struts into the casino a changed man (still to the tune of "Luck Be a Lady"). Even his limp seems less prono as he greets fellow workers as they pass. He catches a glimpse of himself in a wall mirror. Maybe f the first time, he likes what he sees. In the reflection notices Natalie smiling at him. He meets her eyes. She av them quickly, keeps walking.
Shelly watches Bernie from the video monitor. He appears  less than delighted over Bernie's sunny disposition. He p up the phone, dials.
(into phone) Yeah, it's me. Get Bernie over to  crap table six.
Per usual, Bernie walks up to the bar, asks for a cup of  coffee. Doris slides it over.
(looking around) Got any cre --
Before he can answer, Doris hands him a container of crea A full container. Taken aback, he starts pouring it into cup, when he hears a VOICE over the intercom:
Lovett, party of six, your table is  ready, Lovett, party of six.
Bernie looks to Doris.
Duty calls.

A -- Bernie arrives at a hundred dollar blackjack table j in time for the dealer to bust out. The crowd goes crazy! B -- Bernie takes a break by leaning up against the side a slot machine. Suddenly, the woman playing it hits a jac C -- Everywhere he seems to go, people continue to win. D -- Bernie, despite the spooky irony, can't help but smi as mountains of chips pile up on the tables. Shelly appea behind him. Not a happy camper. He gestures Bernie to fol him.
They head over to a section of slots. As they pass one of those huge million dollar slots, the FLOOR MANAGER cuts i front of them.

Hey, Shelly, check it out. The new  Mega-Million. I call her Marnie,  'cause she's one frigid broad. Sure,  once in a while she'll flash you a  bit of tit, but your chances of  hitting a home run -- one in twenty  million. Here, give her a shot...
He hands Shelly a cup of quarters, takes off. Shelly look to Bernie. He's trying to keep a lid on his anger.
(feeding Marnie  quarters) You wanna tell me what's going on  out there?
I don't know...
Shelly pulls the lever.
What do you mean...
Marnie immediately spits out a small jackpot.
(reacts with surprise) What do you mean, you don't know?  We're down almost a mil out there.  Doesn't seem strange to you?
(shrugs) Guess I'm having an off day.
You don't have off days, Lootz. You're  shitty luck incarnate. What's wrong?  You coming down with something? You've  got this look about you...
Shelly starts feeding Marnie again.
Nothing's wrong. Fact is, I've never  felt better.
What's that supposed to mean?
She loves me, Shelly. She told me  last night. Natalie.

On the mention of Natalie's name, we hear a shrieking SIR followed by a deafening toll of slot bells. Shelly's just landed the million dollar jackpot. Shelly stares at the s in surprise -- then looks over at Bernie. Realization hit hard. Fuck! The floor manager staggers over. His expressi is priceless.
Sweet Jesus... you popped her  cherries.

SEVERAL CASINO WORKERS have gathered to witness the  deflowering of Marnie. They gaze reverently upon her, as witnessing the "Close Encounters" mothership for the firs time. Shelly drags Bernie out of earshot.
Natalie? She told you, she loves  you?
Bernie nods, a huge grin wrenching his cheeks apart. He's about to go helium on us.
Natalie's serving drinks to a table of high rollers, when Tony and Lou appear behind her...

The door to Shelly's office slams behind Natalie. Shelly  glares at her from behind his desk. We see him thumbing h steel abacus. The beads drifting toward the center. Natal shakily lights up a cigarette.
Put that fucking thing out!
Natalie, startled, drops her cigarettes. She kneels to ga them up.
Sorry.

You should be. You've gone and fucked  it up big time. I paid you to be his  cooze companion, not his fucking  true love. But, no, you had to go  and get all profound on the poor  schmuck. (mimics female voice) "I love you, Bernie." You know what  you've gone and done, sweetheart?  Those four little words of endearment  have already cost this casino a  million and counting today.
I don't understand...

(jumps to his feet) Lady luck. You never heard'a lady  luck?! That's what's goin' on out  there. Lootz is Kryptonite on a stick.  He should have 'em throwing ice cubes  out there, but instead I got a fuckin'  meltdown on my hands.
Shelly walks around his desk to Natalie.
OK, here's what's gonna happen. You're  outta his life by the time he gets  home. Don't even tell him to his  face, just leave a note. I'll make  some calls, situate you at another  joint.
I can't do that.
(right in her face) Excuse me?
It wasn't an act. I meant it. I love  him.
(close to losing it) What's there to fuckin' love? He's a  loser. Always has been, always will  be.
I thought you were his friend...

And I thought you were a smart cookie  when I picked you out. You do not  want to fuck me over, darlin'. I'll  see to it that your next John's a  rattlesnake out in the desert. Now  get the fuck outta here.
Natalie rushes from the office in tears. Shelly closes hi eyes for a moment -- gotta keep it together.
Bernie approaches some cocktail waitresses about to go of duty.
Hi. Any of you seen Natalie around?  I'm supposed to give her a ride home.
I think she left already. She wasn't  feelin' too good. We been covering  for her.
Off Bernie's expression: Oh...
Bernie's Buick pulls into the lot. He parks, heads for hi room.
Bernie enters. Flips on the light. No Natalie.
(calls to the bathroom) Natalie? You in there?
No answer. He heads over. Finds it empty. Concern spreads across his features. He glances around the room. Notices closet wide open. Natalie's clothes missing.
(sotto) Natalie.
That's when he catches sight of the note taped to the dre mirror. He rushes over, rips it off.

text: Bernie slumps to the floor in disbelief. Starts to trembl Then rocks back and forth, wracked by stifled sobs. Chris make it stop hurting...

Bernie seated at the foot of the bed, drinking bourbon fr a solitary glass. He's almost gone through an entire bott He glances down, notices a pair of Natalie's stockings  sticking out from under the bed. He brings them up to his face. Breathes her in, only to exhale a sorry breath.
Bernie stops at the bar for a cup of coffee. Doris starts pour the cream... whoops... empty. Bernie shrugs. Par for the course. Time to go to work.
We see Bernie back in top form. Forget Mr. Cool, he's tur into Mr. Freeze with a vengeance. The high rollers are fa a nuclear winter on the floor thanks to Bernie.

A -- A man with a fresh bankroll sits at a card table ful of hubris. Bernie pulls up a chair next to him. B -- We see a crowd of players hovering over a busy craps table. The cheerful congregation turns sour as the dice a flung. Players groan as they jettison the table, leaving  just Bernie... C -- We see a dealer pull a six card twenty one as player sit with twelves and thirteens. They sit stunned as their money is swept away. The same man with the hefty bankroll unclips the last of his green. He throws it over to the d to change in. D -- Larry, roaming the floor, is visibly disturbed by  Bernie's cooling ability. It's something he can't quantif and it unsettles him. He glances up toward Shelly's  observation window, knows the man is gloating. Good call. From behind the glass, Shelly lights up a stog Hint of a smile. You go, Bernie.
Johnny Cappella rocks the house. PAN ACROSS to Shelly and Bernie seated in Shelly's booth. Shelly is in a jovial mo while Bernie is a portrait of misery.
I want you to tell me the truth,  Shelly. Did you say something to  Natalie? Did you muscle her --
Jesus, Bernie, is that what you think  of me? That I would fuck with your  happiness? That hurts.
Bernie shrugs an apology, shifts his gaze to Johnny Cappe
This guy's all flash. No soul. I  miss Buddy. Place isn't the same  without him.
Buddy was tired. I gave him an easy  out. It coulda been a lot worse...
(confused) You gave him an easy out? What are  you talkin' about? I thought he...
Shelly looks almost... tortured. Something he needs to ge off his chest.
He woulda never taken the buy-out  offer. Buddy woulda stuck to his  guns, no matter what. And they woulda  ended up hurting him. I couldn't let  that happen.
Jesus... you... How can you sit here  and justify it? Like you were Dr.  Kevorkian or something?

Listen to me, you dumb fuck -- I  loved that sonofabitch. But his time  was up. What I was supposed to do,  leave him to those corporate wolves?  What I did, it was the humanitarian  thing. That I have no doubt about.  Afterwards, I held him in my arms  and I cried like a fucking baby.  What? You got this look -- what's  this fucking look?
Off Bernie's shocked expression --

Bernie sits watching TV, a bottle of Ten High next to him the bed. Same religious channel. This time it's a mass ba taking place on some river bank. He's about to doze off,  when he hears a light rapping on the door. He cocks his h not sure if it's the booze talking. Bernie throws open the door -- Natalie standing there. A lonely angel framed in the door Suitcase at her feet. 24 carat tears glistening in the da They just stare at each other for an extended beat. Then  Natalie stumbles into Bernie's arms. Clingwraps herself t him. Bernie squeezes his eyes closed. Holds on for dear l It's a different kind of pain now; one that hurts so good
from over Bernie's shoulder. There's a bittersweet look a her. Nothing good can come of this. But that's tomorrow. long ways off.
Bernie and Natalie lie in each other's arms. Bernie seems ease. Natalie eyeballs the ceiling, smoke wisping up from cigarette.
Bernie? You awake?
Yeah.
Let's just take off.
Bernie looks over at her.
I mean it. Let's just pack up and  go. Tonight.
(closes his eyes) I can't do that. I've got an  obligation to Shelly. There's no --
Fuck Shelly. He doesn't give a shit  about you. Let's just climb into  your car and get the hell out of  here.
Bernie cuts her off.
I can't do that, Natalie. They'd  come after me. And because you were  with me... I wouldn't want that on  me.
Natalie finishes her cigarette. Well, she's made her bed. Bernie starts nuzzling her. She turns away.
Just hold me.

Shelly looking on as a high roller cleans up at craps. Wi Bernie standing right there next to the guy. Which only seems to make it worse, as Bernie's presence s the player on to an even bigger win. Bernie has that goofy "my heart is full" look about him. Which can mean only one thing in Shelly's book. The man l about ready to split an atom. We see Larry hovering nearb with a smug grin. Off of Shelly's enraged expression...
Lou's black Oldsmobile pulls into the parking lot. Shelly and the boys climb out, head for...

Natalie's sunning herself at the pool. The only other peo around are a middle-aged couple and a young boy. Shelly (slipping on his leather gloves), followed by Lou Tony, strides purposefully up to Natalie -- no hellos, no just grabs her by the hair...
Hey! Ouch! What are you...?
He drags Natalie over to Bernie's room, kicks the door op shoves Natalie inside...
Shelly throws Natalie onto the bed. Lou closes the door a draws the blinds.
You got no fucking right...!
What did I tell you?! What did I  fuckin' tell you?!
I tried... I couldn't...
I don't give a fuck!
Shelly heads over to the closet, rips it open, pulls out suitcase. He starts throwing Natalie's clothes into the c
You're gone, sweetheart. History.  Kiss paradise goodbye.
(hysterical) I can't leave! I won't! I love him.  Doesn't that mean anything to you,  you heartless fuck?
Shelly stops packing. He grabs Natalie up off the bed, st smacking her around.
Who the fuck do you think you are?  You ain't nobody! I could make you  disappear like this... (snaps his fingers) And nobody would ever notice you  were gone. Nobody!
(yells) Bernie would! I got friends! You  don't fuckin' own me. You got no  right --
Shelly lifts Natalie up, throws her across the room into dresser mirror. SMASH! She crumbles to the floor, glass  showering her. Natalie grabs up a shard, rushes Shelly wi it...
Fuck you!

She slashes Shelly across the arm. Ouch, fuck! Before Ton and Lou can make a move, Shelly ensnares her wrist -- sna it backwards -- AARRRRGGHHH!!! Shelly snatches up the sha shoves her back on the bed. We see her terror reflected i the jagged glass against her cheek...
You fuckin' cunt...
He slices her cheek open. Tony and Lou look on with mutual expressions: Shelly's ge a little carried away here. Shelly staggers to his feet...

You think that's bad? That's just a  taste, bitch. You're still here when  Bernie gets home and I'll finish the  job. I'll cut you into so many fuckin'  pieces, the vultures'll be trading  on you for a month.
Shelly reaches into his jacket, pulls out a wad of bills. Throws them at Natalie.
Here... go get yourself some cosmetic  surgery.
Shelly gestures to Tony and Lou. They exit the room, leav Natalie sobbing into one of Bernie's pillows.
Bernie parks. Heads for his room. He's about to reach for his key, when he realizes the door is slightly ajar. He p his way into...
...darkness.
Natalie.
Bernie fumbles for the light switch...
No, don't. I've got a headache.
(closing the door) Did you take something? I got some  aspirin in the --
Yeah. I already took something.
